members.member:
Register a new HTTP endpoint via DuetWebServer. This wil create a new HTTP endpoint under /machine/{Namespace}/{EndpointPath}. Returns a path to the UNIX socket which DuetWebServer will connect to whenever a matching HTTP request is received. A plugin using this command has to open a new UNIX socket with the given path that DuetWebServer can connect to
.

member.name: T:DuetAPI.Connection.InitMessages.InterceptInitMessage
member.summary: Enter interception mode Whenever a code is received, the connection must respond with one of - Ignore to pass through the code without modifications - Resolve to resolve the current code and to return a message In addition the interceptor may issue custom commands once a code has been received Do not attempt to perform commands before an intercepting code is received, else the order of command execution cannot be guaranteed

member.name: P:DuetAPI.Connection.InitMessages.ServerInitMessage.Version
member.summary: Version of the server-side API. A client is supposed to check if this API level s greater than or equal to this value once a connection has been etablished in order to ensure that all of the required commands are actually supported by the control server.

member.name: P:DuetAPI.Connection.InitMessages.ServerInitMessage.Id
member.summary: Unique connection ID assigned by the control server to allow clients to track their commands

member.name: T:DuetAPI.Connection.InitMessages.SubscribeInitMessage
member.summary: Enter subscription mode and receive either the full object model or parts of it after every update

member.name: M:DuetAPI.Connection.InitMessages.SubscribeInitMessage.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new init message instance

member.name: P:DuetAPI.Connection.InitMessages.SubscribeInitMessage.SubscriptionMode
member.summary: Type of the subscription

member.name: P:DuetAPI.Connection.InitMessages.SubscribeInitMessage.Filter
member.summary: Optional filter path for mode
member.remarks: The style of a filter is similar to XPath. For example, if you want to monitor only the current heater temperatures, you can use the filter expression "heat/heaters[*]/current". Wildcards are supported either for full names or indices. To get updates for an entire namespace, the ** wildcard can be used (for example heat/** for everything heat-related), however it can be only used at the end of a filter expression. Multiple filters can be used on one connection and they have to be delimited by one of these charaters: ['|', ',', ' ', '\r', '\n']

member.name: T:DuetAPI.Connection.InterceptionMode
member.summary: Type of the intercepting connection

member.name: F:DuetAPI.Connection.InterceptionMode.Pre
member.summary: Intercept codes before they are internally processed by the control server

member.name: F:DuetAPI.Connection.InterceptionMode.Post
member.summary: Intercept codes after the initial processing of the control server but before they are forwarded to the RepRapFirmware controller

member.name: F:DuetAPI.Connection.InterceptionMode.Executed
member.summary: Receive a notification for executed codes. In this state the final result can be still changed

member.name: T:DuetAPI.Connection.SubscriptionMode
member.summary: Type of the model subscription

member.name: F:DuetAPI.Connection.SubscriptionMode.Full
member.summary: Receive full object model after every update
member.remarks: Generic messages may or may not be included in the full object model. To keep track of messages reliably, it is strongly advised to create a subscription in mode.

member.name: F:DuetAPI.Connection.SubscriptionMode.Patch
member.summary: Receive only updated JSON fragments of the object model
